instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
Has no liquid damage. No video on internal or external. Using known good internal LCD.Turns on and chimes but no video.

L9410 and L9330 0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.2v

what to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Check GPU power up sequence, page 68.

threads.message: This is having a issue to where it wonâ€™t boot from usb install or internet recovery. A little over 1/2 way progress bar fans spin really fast screen goes dark. Have to hold power button to turn off and when turned back on same cycle repeats. Is this a FDM608 issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
Could be GPU issue.
Try Linux, or Windows Live USB.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: boots from mac os external drive no problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: It will only boot from external drive with  OS already installed. When trying to boot from usb installer the screen goes black about 1/2 way through after fans spin real fast. Same goes for a internal SSD with fresh install from another system

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: If you can enter macOS through USB, then try GPU stress test, like Unigine Heaven.
